abstract: Report released by nonprofit ocean conservation group Oceana finds two-thirds of salmon sold by restaurants that is labeled wild-caught is mislabeled farm-raised salmon; twenty percent of farm-raised salmon is similarly mislabeled in groceries.
lead_paragraph: Over all, 43 percent of the salmon Oceana collected — in New York, Washington, Chicago and Virginia, from upscale and takeout restaurants, and from various neighborhood and chain groceries— was misidentified

headline.main: Though Labeled ‘Wild,’ That Serving of Salmon May Be Farmed or ‘Faux’
headline.print_headline: Though Labeled ‘Wild,’ That Serving of Salmon May Be Farmed or ‘Faux’

snippet: Over all, 43 percent of the salmon Oceana collected — in New York, Washington, Chicago and Virginia, from upscale and takeout restaurants, and from various neighborhood and chain groceries— was misidentified
